result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Griffith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No contact with Heather Cook or her son, JLC.  Absolute sobriety.  Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M. Griffith in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez makes correction to PSI.  Ms. Cook gives statement.  Ms. Bebensee gives statement.  State recommends 17 years prison (12 IC/5 ES) with all conditions of PSI.  Atty Martinez recommends lengthy probation with 1 year jail and all other conditions of the PSI or impose and stay prison.  Ms. Griffith gives statement.  

WI State Prison for 15 years (11 years Initial Confinement/4 years Extended Supervision)  
2 days credit
All conditions of PSI imposed
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on December 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph M. Griffith in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Martinez will be requesting a reset today.  Court addressing receiving the PSI.  Attorney Martinez and Attorney Hoffman have received the PSI and reviewed, however Defendant has not had a chance to review.  State objects to any reset, victim rights.  Attorney Martinez argues allowing the reset.  Based on the circumstances/explanation, Court has no other choice but to grant the reset.  Attorney Martinez request 30 days.  State objects and request a sooner date and also request revoking bond due to prison recommendation.  Attorney Martinez explains his calendar for the next month and objects to revoking the bond.  No modification of bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Status conference on January 18, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
appointing counsel

Defendant Joseph M. Griffith in court with attorney Joseph L Viney appearing by phone.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Viney states status of the matter.  Says DE is requesting he withdraw so he can obtain new counsel.  State is under the same understanding.  DE is in agreement and does wish for Atty Viney to withdraw.  Court advises DE of results re: JT if Atty Viney is allowed to withdraw.  DE still wishes Atty Viney be allowed to withdraw and would like new counsel appointed.  Court will allow Atty Viney to withdraw as court-appointed counsel and JT set for 11/21/2016 will be rescheduled.  Court appoints Atty Andrew Martinez (144 4th Ave #2, Baraboo (608) 355-2000) to represent the DE.  Court advises DE to make contact w/Atty Martinez ASAP.  Status will be set in 45 days.  Court advises DE that he may not be appointed new counsel again in the future as this was already set for JT.  Bond continued.  State notes victim was notified re: today's hearing and wishes the matter to proceed in a timely manner.
2nd Amended

Defendant Joseph M. Griffith in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion in limine filed by State. Atty. Viney has no objection to motions in limine.  Court grants those motions filed by State.  DE files witness list today.  Bond continues.

Defendant Joseph M. Griffith by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Joseph M. Griffith in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does not qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond of $2,500.  Atty Middleton responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $10,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/H.L.C. (dob 10/17/90) or J.L.C. (dob 8/23/05).
